intro: Tapeinidium tenue, commonly known as the slender tapeinidium, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
